postProcessing.question: What is post-processing?
postProcessing.answer: AI-powered cleanup of your transcript. It removes filler words (um, uh, like) and fixes grammar while keeping technical terms. Use --post-process flag or enable in Desktop settings.

requirements.question: What do I need?
requirements.answer:
Cloud mode: An API key from your chosen provider.
Local mode: Just run whis setup local (downloads ~500MB model).
CLI only: Requires FFmpeg for audio encoding.

privacy.question: What about my data?
privacy.answer:
Cloud: Audio is sent to your provider's servers for processing.
Local: Everything stays on your machine—never leaves.
whis doesn't store recordings or transcripts.

presets.question: What are presets?
presets.answer: Output formats for different use cases. Built-in: ai-prompt, email, default. Use with whis --as email or create your own with whis presets new.

piping.question: Can I pipe output to other tools?
piping.answer:
Yes! Use --print to output to stdout instead of clipboard:
whis --print | pbcopy
whis -f audio.mp3 --print > transcript.txt

uninstall.question: How do I uninstall?
uninstall.answer:
Flatpak: flatpak uninstall ink.whis.Whis
AppImage: Run with --uninstall flag, then delete the file.
Other: Remove the binary and ~/.config/whis/ folder.
